2007 |conference_season = }} The '''Wright State Raiders''' team is the basketball team that represents [[Wright State University]] in [[Dayton, Ohio|Dayton]], [[Ohio]], USA. The school's team currently competes in the [[Horizon League]]. The team last played in the [[NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament]] in [[2007 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|2007]]. The Raiders are currently coached by [[Billy Donlon]]. The Raiders play at the Ervin J. Nutter Center in Fairborn, Ohio in what is often nicknamed the 'NUTT HOUSE'. Wright State's biggest rival is [[Butler Bulldogs men's basketball|Butler]], who they are 15-20 against all time. ==History== Wright State first sponsored men's basketball in 1970. In 1983, Wright State won the [[NCAA Men's Division II Basketball Championship|Division II NCAA Tournament]]. Wright State moved to Division I in 1987, and have made NCAA Tournament appearances in 1993 and 2007. ==Record== This charts shows WSU's records season by season since joining Division I in 1987. {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" !
